lexUnit.name: trickle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small group or number of people or things moving slowly.

sentence.text: The village has attracted only a trickle of visitors .
To the shrine came a trickle of pilgrims , which by the eleventh and twelfth centuries was growing into a flood .
There is therefore opportunity for only a trickle of legislation from this source and , for reasons stated below , even less than that flows .
This is a good moment to recall the last trickle of white immigration to arouse official panic .
There was a gulp from the extinguisher 's valve and a trickle of yellow-white liquid dribbled pathetically from its nozzle .
There was a trickle of traffic , now , and she overtook the sleepy drivers with an almost reckless haste .
Talking to Bryan Robson this week , the skipper was full of optimism , saying how well United are starting to play , and Cantona could turn that trickle of confidence into a tide .
He glimpsed a trickle of moisture on her cheek where the light caught it .
As it is , run by successive governments who ca n't seem to help , Jamaica needs a steady trickle of tourist dollars .
Deprived of a swim , Henrietta decided to wash her hair but the bathroom tap could only be persuaded to emit a trickle of dark brown water , after which it coughed , spluttered and ran dry .
His eyes grew bulbous and a small trickle of spittle crept from the corner of his mouth .
Trickles of sweat dripped from her hair and down her temples , leaving an itchy heat behind them .
There were no windows and only a trickle of light came in through the door behind him .
His efforts were rewarded by an agonised groan from the plumbing , a shudder , and a thin trickle of water .
He prepared the altar for Mass , opened the-door and waited for the small trickle of his congregation to enter .
But over the last twelve months the trickle of disclosures , has grown into a river of revelations .
The hound grunted with pain and he let it fall limp at his feet , a small dark trickle of blood flowing from one nostril .
She 'd obviously hit her head during the impact because there was a small trickle of blood on her forehead .
Starkly outlined against the pale skin of his lower jaw , a thin trickle of blood was running from one corner of his mouth .
